intro: Ficus subgelderi, commonly known as the Variegated Ficus or Ficus subgelderi Variegata, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with striking white or light green variegation patterns. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by small, round fig fruits. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires moderate humidity and well-draining soil. Ficus subgelderi is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
